page.title: 09CHURCHS AT UMBERLEIGH
page.content: THE LOCAL CHURCH-Umberleigh Christian Fellowship was first built in 1920. The walls of the church are made of stone and the roof is black tiles which are made from bricks. There are about 200 hymn books. The seats are comfortable. The church has a family service every month. The caretaker lives next to the church at Hazelcroft. The service times on Sunday are 11am and 6.30pm Mid week there are prayer or group meetings and Sunday School is held during Sunday morning service. There are clubs for young boys,girls and teenagers. There is also a Church of England church which is looked after by the vicar from South Molton now that the vicar from Chittlehampton has recently died. It is a small quaint building built of wood.
